CONJUGATES: noun: maximum (singular) | maxima (plural, formal) | maximums (plural, common); adjective: maximum (no comparative/superlative)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin maximum, neuter of maximus 'greatest', superlative of magnus 'great'.

MEANINGS.PATTERN:
the maximum [of sth]
reach its maximum
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The greatest amount, size, or degree allowed or possible.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 允许或可能的最大数量、尺寸或程度。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The temperature reached a maximum of 30 degrees Celsius today.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 今天气温最高达到了30摄氏度。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word naming an attribute of a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: As great as possible; greatest or highest.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 尽可能大的；最大或最高的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We need to achieve maximum efficiency to finish the project on time.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们需要达到最高效率才能按时完成项目。

REGISTER: General usage, common in both formal and informal contexts.
